result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheena L. Angeloff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.   Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
*Pay restitution in the sum of $2,703.93 plus surcharges.
*Add the 5% restitution surcharge now.
May not have contact with victim/business, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheena L. Angeloff

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Young.  Clerk HMcBride.  State is compliant with victim rights notification. Stip to restitution in the amt of $2703.93.  On state's motion, repeater enhancer is dismissed.  DE enters guilty plea. Court finds DE guilty. Court imposes and stays 6 months incarceration and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions; credit for 4 days if revoked;  restitition ordered $2703.93;   DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.    Appeal rights given.
8/5 8:45am - time changed by court to 10am.  Confirmed with Atty Young by email this day.  FO trails.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Young.   Clerk HMcBride. Atty Young requests adjmt for further discussions with DE.  State investigating restitution amt.  FPT 8/5 845am. Bond continued.  FO trails.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Triangle Appliance - Kenosha.

01:29 PM    Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
